title: Can't connect to Riot in-game server! Day 6
body:
Why can't I connect to 192.64.170.252?
Why did my in game ping increase by a constant 80ms 6 days ago? (NOT lag spike, a CONSTANT increase.)
Why is only League affected? (No other sites like google or games have increased ping)

---------------------------------------
Attempting to ping 192.64.170.252 results in "Request timed out" 100% of the time.

WinMTR Diagnostic trace to 192.64.170.252: [HERE](http://pastebin.com/BHD5ZQmP)

---------------------------------------
Attempting to ping 104.160.131.1 results in "Minimum = 109ms, Maximum = 110ms, Average = 109ms" (Was 30ms until 6 days ago, has failed to drop below 109ms since)

WinMTR Diagnostic trace to 104.160.131.1: [HERE](http://pastebin.com/KJAQebgP)

---------------------------------------
Attempting to ping google.com results in "Minimum = 25ms, Maximum = 27ms, Average = 26ms" (Normal)



---------------------------------------

I've already read through and attempted everything from Riot's Network guide, I have already downloaded and ran the Hextech Repair Tool.

replies.body:
It's pretty clear that your network is having a hard time reaching our NA test server 104.160.131.1 since you're getting a minimum ping of 109ms. I won't be able to see where this ping is spiking until I can see the full traceroute. 

If I could get you to run Win MTR again with 104.160.131.1 as the host, and this time take a screenshot or copy/paste the full log with each server line the ping goes through. That way I'll be able to look at this more in depth.

Weird, in my original post I linked to the results of the trace but they didn't show up for some reason... I've edited the original post so the links should appear now.

Here are the results for the WinMTR to 104.160.131.1 [LINK](http://pastebin.com/KJAQebgP)

Here are the results for the WinMTR to 192.64.170.252 [LINK](http://pastebin.com/BHD5ZQmP)

Thanks!

It looks like your ping starts hitting the 80's around the time it first starts coming to our servers. I'd like for our tech guys to be able to take a look at your issue one on one in a ticket, and they'll be able to provide much more context into what could be going on there. 

Reach out to our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new), and they'll be with you soon!

Just wanted to let you know, as of yesterday problem was solved! I don't know what happened exactly, but thank you to you and the server people!

Current WinMTR to 104.160.131.1 = [HERE](http://pastebin.com/GyF7we2v)
I am having the same issue, I am using Nexicom as well. Called them and put in a ticket, but not sure when I will hear from them.
